intro: Echites cimicidus, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its dark green, waxy leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant contains toxic compounds, including cardioactive glycosides, which make it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care and is not typically cultivated for ornamental purposes.
